sentences.english: Then they found a young fish who was known for playing hooky from school.
sentences.chinese: 于是他们找了条以逃学出名的小鱼仔。

sentences.english: Because I got caught playing hooky .
For a moment I thought of playing truant.
sentences.chinese: 逃学的念头在我脑子里闪了一下。

sentences.english: I was skipping school at the time in my parents' house.
sentences.chinese: 那时，我逃学，意外就发生在家里。

sentences.english: Peter was skinned for playing truant.
His bruise was a trick to play truant from school.
sentences.chinese: 他以瘀伤作为逃学的藉囗。

sentences.english: He neglected his schooling and lived on the streets.
Lucy talked Dan out of skipping class.
The three boys who are fishing over there are truants and ought to be sent back to school.
sentences.chinese: 那边那3个钓鱼的孩子都是逃学者，应当被送回学校。

sentences.english: Mencius once played truant, and she cut the cloth she was weaving to show her seriousness.
sentences.chinese: 一次孟子逃学，孟母就割断织机的布来教子。

sentences.english: Though he often plays hooky, he does well in study.
sentences.chinese: 他经常逃学，然而他的功课却很好。

sentences.english: Afraid of being scolded, for a moment, little Franz thought of truant.
sentences.chinese: 因为害怕挨骂，小弗朗兹一时起了逃学的念头。

sentences.english: The student who played hooky was punished by the principal.
sentences.chinese: 逃学的那位学生被校长处罚了。

sentences.english: Afraid of being scolded, for a moment, little Franz thought of playing truant.
sentences.chinese: 由于害怕挨骂，小弗朗兹一时起了逃学的念头。

sentences.english: She plays truant now and then.

definition: to leave home (to live somewhere else)
to drop out of school/to leave off studying/to interrupt one's studies
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
to go to school/to attend school
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
